channel.title: [317] "No response from server, please try using a differnt world."
channel.description:
I get this error only after the client has already connected to my TestScape based source once. I've connected to the server manually (using a tool similar to telnet) and it logs an accepted connection.
I've googled around a bit and found that this can be related to the client sending a UID? In my source, I check the client's UID to ensure that it's the one I've put in my client - the one in the client does not change.
Do I need to let the client have a random UID? Do I need to clear a player object or client object / UID somewhere in the source?

item.title: [317] "No response from server, please try using a differnt world."
item.dc:creator: @jSherz jSherz
item.description:
@jSherz wrote:

It turns out that I had another method in place that was denying the clients access to the server if they’re already connected yet didn’t clear their IP.

If you look in server.java, under:

while (true) { java.net.Socket s = clientListener.accept();

Anything that runs:

Or stops the code getting to some variation of:

Will cause the client to give that error.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] "No response from server, please try using a differnt world."
